Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Teachers from Frick United Academy of Language demanded to know why, if testing took place in April, fountains weren’t shut down until August.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: from Frick United Academy of Language

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Community members pointed out that other districts have lower thresholds for remediation.
Community members, many of whom raised concerns two weeks ago, were skeptical.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: many of whom raised concerns two weeks ago

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to a report from this week’s Oakland Unified school board meeting
Document Sources.Source Justification: from this week’s Oakland Unified school board meeting

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: The district’s safe drinking water policy states that any water sources showing lead at above 5 parts per billion must be taken offline and repaired.
Document Sources.Source Justification: The district’s safe drinking water policy

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: In 2017, when OUSD was considering its clean drinking water policy, the cost to upgrade all the pipes would have been $38 million
Document Sources.Source Justification: In 2017, when OUSD was considering its clean drinking water policy

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "This mistake has caused families stress, anxiety and panic, further limiting our community’s trust in this district," said Max Simmons, one of OUSD’s student directors.
"I sincerely apologize for the stress and concern this has caused our school sites, students and families.
"There is so much trust rebuilding that has to be done for our community.
"Why didn’t you do your job? You knew months ago that the water was contaminated.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: a parent at Madison Park Academy and an organizer with Communities for a Better Environment

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "This is not new to Oakland, but it is something that we need to tackle as an entire city, and we need to have community partners, philanthropic partners, as well as our county and state folks to support us in dealing with this issue,"
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Director, chair of OUSD’s facilities committee

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: OUSD also committed to redesigning its water quality website and publishing a dashboard by Jan. 1 for community members to view test results.
Alameda County recommends that any families who were notified that their schools had elevated lead levels should get their child a blood lead test.
In Berkeley Unified, water fixtures testing above 1 part per billion are taken offline and repaired.
